question: A 0.5 kg ball is thrown with an initial velocity of 10 m/s. It collides with a wall and bounces back with a velocity of -8 m/s. What is the magnitude of the impulse exerted on the ball by the wall?
solution: Impulse (J) is equal to the change in momentum (Δp). The initial momentum is p_i = mv_i = 0.5 kg × 10 m/s = 5 kg⋅m/s. The final momentum is p_f = mv_f = 0.5 kg × (-8 m/s) = -4 kg⋅m/s. The change in momentum is Δp = p_f - p_i = -4 kg⋅m/s - 5 kg⋅m/s = -9 kg⋅m/s. The magnitude of the impulse is |J| = |Δp| = |-9 kg⋅m/s| = 9 kg⋅m/s = 9 N⋅s.
